V.iii.1.B.4.g
.
Separate Evaluations – Genu Recurvatum
When evaluating genu recurvatum, which involves hyperextension of the knee beyond 0 degrees of extension, under
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5263
do
not also
evaluate separately under
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5261
, but
do
evaluate separately under other evaluations
if
manifestations that are not overlapping, such as limitation of flexion under
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5260
, are attributed to genu recurvatum, and
do
not
evaluate separately under
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5257
; however, if instability is manifested from genu recurvatum evaluate based on the criteria that will provide the highest evaluation.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section B - Musculoskeletal Disabilities of the Extremities and Spine
